data.title: GDScript completion for Pool*Arrays still uses the old names
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 â€“ Godot 3.0 alpha (9a502d3c17d4701b0fd8390e515c52a69dc0bf85)

**Issue description:**
GDScript completion wasn't updated to the new `Pool*Array` types and still show the old `*Array` format (like `Vector2Array`).

Should be an easy fix.

data.title: Glow effect doesn't work on non-opaque alpha-enabled materials
data.body:
**Ubuntu 17.04, Windows 7 - Godot version: 2.1.4**


**Issue description:**
When an alpha-enabled material has an alpha channel inferior to 255, no glowing will show up.

data.title: RayCast2D arrows displayed wrong
data.body:
** Ubuntu 14.04 - 2.1.4-BETA :**


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
RayCast2D arrows will displayed wrong in the editor.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just create a new RayCast2D object. The arrow will be displayed wrong, 90 degrees counterclockwise.

data.title: Not able to print any Output [macOS Sierra]
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
- **Device:** MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Mid 2014)
- **OS:** macOS Sierra 10.12.5 (16F73)
- **Godot version:** v2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Not able to print any text in the _Output tab_

![godot-no-output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9617583/28182906-940ac83a-67db-11e7-8472-59ce285900b1.gif)


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Created a script attached to an object.
2. Declared a print() function with some text.
3. The function gets called but no Output text gets rendered.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[godot-no-output.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1146318/godot-no-output.zip)

data.title: Add GZIP compression support
data.body:
Also fix a wrong call in `PoolByteArray::compress`.

I know @tagcup wants to change the way compression level works, but for now I'll follow the current standard.

data.title: Feature Proposal..  add a 'clone project' to the projects window
data.body:
Request to add a 'clone project' to the projects window when it first opens.

Other enhancement to the projects window:
- add default workspace location(s), when creating a new project you can specify A, B, C, etc locations rather than having to navigate all the time to the actual location.

data.title: Godot doesn't quit
data.body:
Godot 2.1.3 Windows 10 64 bits
Same in Godot 2.1.4 alpha

I am in a state where Godot doesn't close. If I try to close the window, it asks if I want to quit, I press "quit", and nothing happens. Same when clicking "Quit to project list", the project manager opens but Godot stays open in the background.

I don't know how to reproduce this yet, all I did was to open Godot, search for some docs, click a link in the doc, open a script... then close.

The only error I have in the console is:
```
ERROR: RichTextLabel::scroll_to_line: Index p_line out of size (main->lines.size()).
   At: scene\gui\rich_text_label.cpp:1729
```
Which has happened before I quit and doesn't happen again when I retry to quit.

EDIT: I restarted Godot, did nothing, tried to quit: it still doesn't close.
This time the only error is:
```
ERROR: PopupMenu::set_item_checked: Index p_idx out of size (items.size()).
   At: scene\gui\popup_menu.cpp:659
```

data.title: regression: allowing setting the loop offset for looped audio files.
data.body: 2.1.x allowed you to specify the point at which audio was to be looped from, via set_loop_restart_time. 3.x has no such similar functionality due to the changes about how audio files are handled. Allowing a loop offset to be specified via the import tools would restore that functionality.

data.title: Tabs enhancements: get_tab_rect(), move_tab()
data.body:
exposed: `get_tab_rect(tab_idx)` can be used to determine position and size of concrete tab 
new and exposed: `move_tab_from_to(idx_from, idx_to)` can be used to rearrange tabs more easily

data.title: Add support for arm64 architecture on Android
data.body:
Follow-up on #6919, which would need a rebase.

Having arm64 architecture support for the Android template would be interesting. Beyond the buildsystem modifications to make it possible to build an arm64 template, the Android export code should also be modified to allow exporting arm64 apks (both standalone and bundled together with armv7 and/or armv5).

data.title: AcceptDialog: fix child w/ ANCHOR_END sized wrong until resized
data.body:
Probably related issues (not sure if fixed by this): #5753 #7654

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. add control as child of acceptdialog/confirmdialog
2. set any anchor as ANCHOR_END
3. save, close, reload scene

data.title: Control: save SIZE_FILL size flag property
data.body: Label has vertical size flag equals to 0 by default. Using ADD_PROPERTYNO with it leads to size flag value 1 (SIZE_FILL) getting reset to 0.

data.title: Editable Children checkbox is never checked

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot master branch f55fff3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

Happened: checkbox is never checked

Enable Editable Children, right-click to see that the checkbox is not checked

data.title: HTTP [GET] and [POST] - "getaddrinfo failed!" error when hosted on linux webserver
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Running with Godot v2.1.3.stable.official

**Issue description:**
I'm playing around with simple GET and POST requests based off this tutorial:(http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/learning/features/networking/http_client_class.html)  

**Function 1: GET**  
On load, I have it connect to a site to make the GET request and it should return the user info (kivabolt) - [http://meehak.com/squared.php]

**Function 2: POST** 
The second function I have is to POST to a different PHP page with a user's input and two hardcoded variables - [http://meehak.com/uploadUserResult.php]
--> to test the POST, i created a different page for manually submitting results (uploadUser.php)[http://meehak.com/uploadUser.php]
 

So when I test the project locally or export the project to a windows / desktop executable, the http requests (GET & POST) execute and have no issues connecting to the URL.



**Problem #1 :** When I upload the exported HTML5 project and host it on a server, I keep getting the error below: 
`ERROR: At: drivers/unix/ip_unix.cpp:106:_resolve_hostname() - getaddrinfo failed!`
 
 
 
Has anyone else ran into this problem? I'm stuck and have no idea what to try next.
I'm hosted via HostGator, no SSL (though I have tried it with an SSL site and hit the same issue)
 
 
[[Github Repository](https://github.com/kivabolt/httpfun)]
 
[[httpfun running on server](http://meehak.com/httpfun/httpfun.html)]

data.title: Image replace color
Add default GDScript templates.
data.body:
Adds some default templates, an empty one (that just extends the base class) and one without the comments.
Note: If you ran a previous build of Godot 3 before, remove or rename the script_templates folder in order to get these.

data.title: Fix fullscreen on X11 for non-resizable windows
data.body:
Previous to this patch this GDscript would have failed to set the fullscreen flag:

```
OS.set_window_resizable(false)
OS.set_window_fullscreen(true)
```

Now it works properly, tested on Ubuntu.

data.body: Fixes #9371

data.title: Input.is_action_pressed not working on Export
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1 64bit (also Windows 10 64bit) - Godot 3.0  Master Branch

**Issue description:**
After exporting game any Input.is_action_pressed doesn't work. However, it does work for versions run from editor. Also Input.is_key_pressed also works (both in editor and exported).


**Steps to reproduce:**
Build current Export template.
Export project that has a input check using the is_action_pressed.
Try the input.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Fastest way to test is to use the Pong example in https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects/tree/master

data.title: Game crashes without error log
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debian 9 - Godot 2.1.3/2.1.4

**Issue description:**
So In my game I have a menu on which I do `self.get_tree().change_scene("world_scene_path")` when "start" is pressed, it takes the player the game "world" and then when the player dies it does `self.get_tree().change_scene("menu_scene_path")`...

Everything works fine, but after dying 2 times, when I click "start" the game crashes and only says "Segment Violation", that's all.

What to do?

data.title: OUYA Controller GUID and button mapping for Godot 3.0 (Android)
data.body: As similar to issue #9390, this patch also updates input_default.cpp to include the OUYA Game Controller GUID and button maps for the Godot Version 3.0 when exporting to Android devices and to OUYA game console, making sure the issue does not result in recent versions of the game engine.

data.title: Godot 3.0 not recognizing old fonts
data.body:
Arch Linux - Godot 3.0

Issue description:
Godot 3.0 does not recognize Godot 2.1.3 .fnt files as fonts. Godot 3.0 looks for a .font file, and if you try to make it load a .fnt file it spits out that it not a resource. Found while converting Godot 2.0 project to Godot 3.0. 

[FlappyGodot3.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1140087/FlappyGodot3.zip)

data.title: Circular inheritance crashes editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Ubuntu 16.04 running Godot 2.1.3


**Issue description:**
When two scripts inherit each other on a `extends` statement and you try to save the second one, the editor crashes. Running Godot on a terminal doesn't output any errors.


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create two GDScripts: test1.gd and test2.gd
2. Open test1.gd and make it inherit "res://test2.gd" (the rest of the file doesn't matter at all)
3. Save test1.gd
4. Open test2.gd and make it inherit "res://test1.gd".
5. When you try to save test2.gd, the editor closes. This happens when using both the shortcut (Ctrl+S) and the File menu.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Not needed, easy to reproduce.
